questions.question: What are the language requirements for crew?
options: Flight Crew must be able to speak the language in common use in all countries through which they operate
Cabin crew must be able to speak English
Cabin crew must learn the language of the flight crew
Flight crew must be able to communicate with cabin crew in a common language
questions.solution: Flight crew must be able to communicate with cabin crew in a common language

questions.question: What must the Flight Safety Programme of all Operators include?
options: Risk awareness and accident evaluation.
Instances of AUM exceedance.
Details of flight hours for Flight crew
Occasions when aeroplanes land with minimum fuel.

questions.question: What must the Operator ensure with regard to additional crew?
options: They must be allocated seats in business class
They must be type rated and current on type
They must not occupy seats by emergency exits
They must be easily distinguishable from cabin crew
questions.solution: They must be easily distinguishable from cabin crew

questions.question: What are the rules for aircraft to comply with ditching requirements?
options: 400 minutes or 120 NM from an aerodrome
400 NM or 120 minutes from an aerodrome
400 NM or 120 minutes from land
400 minutes or 120 NM from land

questions.question: Which of the following are not required to be carried on each flight?
options: CofA
NOTAMS and AIS briefing material
European Health Insurance Card (EHIC) for all crew
Third party insurance certificate
questions.solution: European Health Insurance Card (EHIC) for all crew

questions.question: If EU Operator A wet leases an aeroplane from EU operator B, who is responsible for the airworthiness of the aircraft?
options: A
B
Both are equally responsible
It depends on the year the aircraft was first registered.
